poem_en: I stand beneath a twilight of impossible vows, as a philter’s whisper coils through my veins. Bound by quiet blades and murmurs of fate, I feel your absence lodged like steel beneath my ribs. In a tapestry woven of longing and ash, each thread pulls me closer to the horizon we dared to imagine. If I could strip these layers of sorrow from my soul, I would rise on wings of embers, free of all we once feared.
